intro: Thouinia discolor, commonly known as the white sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Thouinia discolor is adapted to withstand drought and full sun, making it a hardy plant in xerophytic habitats.
